Annotation.note:
The inverse of Simson's theorem: Let $P$ be a point such that the pedal points $X,Y,Z$ of the perpendiculars from $P$ onto the lines passing through pairs of vertices of the triangle $\Delta\,ABC$ are collinear. Then $P$ is a point on the circumscribed circle of $\Delta\,ABC$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
